Clip.Title: MARTIN CLUNES: A MAN AND HIS DOGS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Take a worldwide journey and we investigate where dogs come from, and why on earth they chose us as friends.

Clip.Title: MARTIN CLUNES: A MAN AND HIS DOGS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Out of over 4,000 mammals, how did dogs earn their spot by our side? Join us on our quest for answers.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Bionic Vet and his staff must save a tiny chinchilla that has broken both of his arms and a Labrador puppy that needs a bionic appendage that exactly mirrors his diseased bone to save his life.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Off the eastern coast of Australia lies the Great Barrier Reef - a natural structure so large it stretches for over 1,200 miles and can be seen from outer space. This 6,000 year old underwater empire has been built from as many as 400 different species of coral, and holds some of the world's most iconic animals like clownfish, green sea turtles and barracudas.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Monsoons in Vietnam have been a problem for centuries, but are compounded and strengthened by Climate Change.

Clip.Title: WARSHIPS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Ride along with a Canadian fleet of Warships as they patrol the Persian Gulf.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: High above the St. Lawrence River and into the Gulf of St. Lawrence, an aerial survey above the Gaspe peninsula reveals a set of natural wonders - from the Blue Whales to the stone marvels.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Zoom above some of America's greatest landcapes and monuments in stunning HD realism.

Clip.Title: TERROR IN THE SKIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Footage from the cockpit and cabins of troubled planes shows how tiny cracks, loose bolts, and other small issues have caused big problems for airliners.

Clip.Title: CIVIL WAR 360
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Take a journey back in time and immerse yourself in a 150-year-old battle that nearly split our nation in two. This three-part series explores famous and little known aspects of the Civil War, from the perspectives of the Union, the Confederacy and the millions of enslaved people struggling for freedom. Hosted by Ashley Judd, Trace Adkins, and Dennis Haysbert, all of whom had ancestors greatly affected by the war, this series delivers fresh insights and untold tales, brought to life through dramatic recreations and the Smithsonian Institution's vast collection of artifacts.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: High above the St. Lawrence River and into the Gulf of St. Lawrence, an aerial survey above the Gaspe peninsula reveals a set of natural wonders - from the Blue Whales to the stone marvels.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Eastern Coastline of New Brunswick is an ecological wonder- this aerial survey soars above incredible rock formations, peat farms, and some of the East Coast's most impressive sand dunes.

Clip.Title: TERROR IN THE SKIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Passengers' footage and cockpit recordings reveal how growing trends in pilot fatigue, stress, and boredom are jeopardizing flight safety.

Clip.Title: TERROR IN THE SKIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Recent technical failures aboard commercial aircrafts are detailed through harrowing footage aboard the troubled flights and survivors' firsthand accounts.

Clip.Title: TERROR IN THE SKIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Passengers' videos show flights endangered by various forces of nature, and raise questions about how prepared we really are to fly against the elements.

Clip.Title: TERROR IN THE SKIES
